main event: Multiple unidentified aerial object sightings were reported in Selma, Alabama on different dates in 1952, involving observations of high-speed, evasive, and brightly illuminated objects by civilian and military sources.
interesting points: The reported objects were observed moving at speeds estimated to be between 2,000 and 4,000 mph, which is much higher than the speed capabilities of known aircraft at that time.
The objects were described as making no sound, being very evasive in their movements, and leaving visible vapor trails, characteristics that did not match known aircraft of the era.
One report described a circular object about the size of a 50 cent piece held at arm's length, which later appeared to break up into two parts and move away from each other.
The duration of the sightings ranged from minutes to several hours, indicating sustained observation of the unidentified objects.
The official reports noted that the observed objects did not conform to the characteristics of any known aircraft, indicating the unusual nature of the sightings.
photographs: no photographs included in the reports
